section.p: To improve the quality of your translations, you may wish to check the contents of a Translation Memory from time to time, and modify or remove translations that are stored there. Doing these changes directly in the Translation Memory lets you benefit from polished translations the next time you use this repository.

Therefore, offers a Translation Memory that can be manipulated. You can browse its contents, make changes to existing translations, or delete complete entries from it. You can work on a Translation Memory contents in an editor window as if you were editing normal text. The original segments are displayed in the Original window, the corresponding translations in the Translation window. You make your changes in the Translation window.

Translation Memory files can be huge. To make it easier for you to find a certain translation, you have the choice to narrow down what you are looking for. For example, you can search for a certain translation segment, or for translations made within a certain time frame.
The following describes how to open a Translation Memory in order to work with it.
section.note: Use this function with care. A Translation Memory that has grown over a period of time is an essential asset for all your translations. Therefore it is good practice to avoid any uncontrolled changes. There is no Quit or Undo function. All changes become effective immediately.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: The Translation Memory you want to work with must exist.

section.title: Calling sequence
section.p:
Select:
The Translation Memory List window from the main window
The Translation Memory you wish to edit
Open from the File menu or double-click the Translation Memory name
You are first prompted with the Translation Memory Editor window to specify what you are looking for in the selected Translation Memory. For more information on how to work with this window see .

After you specified the search criteria, the Edit Translation Memory window (see ) is displayed. It consists of two windows. The Original window lets you view the original text, in the Translation window you can make your changes. By pressing Ctrl+Enter you can move from segment to segment. windowsEdit Translation Memory Edit Translation Memory windowFigure shows Edit Translation Memory window

section.title: Results
section.p: You open a Translation Memory to work on the translations that are stored in it. In the Edit Translation Memory window you can browse the original texts and revise the corresponding translations. If you need to change or remove translated text, you can do this in the Translation window where you are assisted by an editor. How you use this editor is explained in .
